RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 13 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.

CLAIM.OWNER: GO Stables and Ramirez Alexa Danae

RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRYPTO MUNNY unhurried early while trailing the field into the first turn, bided his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backside, launched his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly one out from the rail in the drive to get up in deep stretch to prevail. GROOVIN' IS BAK away alertly and stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, slipped through along the rail entering the lead while overhauling the pacesetter, but was unable to fend off CRYPTO MONEY in deep stretch while proving clearly second best. EARS TO US rushed to a clear lead from just off the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace while out from the rail in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, drifted five wide entering the lane, and was outfinished late. THREE DAY BENDER broke sharply and stalked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, continued three wide into the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Groovin' Is Bak
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied rail, closed inside

ENTRY.NAME: Crypto Munny
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, advanced 3/8, rallied inside, close 2 w

ENTRY.NAME: Three Day Bender
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Ears to Us
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEXAS MOONSHINE stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, raced into a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied smartly two wide entering the final turn, assumed command leaving the turn, and drew clear late. C C SUNRISE away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from the inside of DAPPER DON in the run down the backside, eased off his pace rival entering the final turn, angled two wide entering the lane, and closed with late interest two wide in the drive to get up for the place. DEANARROW broke sharply and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing just out from the rail, rallied two wide through the final turn, and closed three wide in the drive to get up for a share. DAPPER DON away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of C C SUNRISE through the stretch the first time and in the run down the backstretch, took a narrow lead into the final turn, but faded in the late stages. BE SPARKY unhurried early while dropping back to trail, was always well back and failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: C C Sunrise
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, drop back 1/4, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Dapper Don
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Moonshine
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Deanarrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Be Sparky
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. (PLUS UP TO $8,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, For Each $2,500 To $20,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $32,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DREAMB away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, rallied from the inside of STANFORD NORTH into the final turn, put away her pace rival leaving the turn, and was all out to hold off a late surge by BUZZINGA KARMA to prevail. BUZZINGA KARMA steadied while running into tight quarters at the rail in the run to the first turn before settling into a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly two out from the rail in the drive to just miss. ANDALEIGH hopped at the start to get away slowly and trailed the field into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive to garner a share. STANFORD NORTH away alertly and dueled for the lead from the outside of DREAMB in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival leaving the turn, and was outfinished late from along the rail. HE'S A SAINT broke sharply and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, commenced his bid four wide entering he final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Buzzinga Karma
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied 5/8, tracked 2w, rallied 3w, closed 3w, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamb
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied rail, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Stanford North
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Andaleigh
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: He's a Saint
ENTRY.OWNER: Scott Robert Long William and McLeod Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 13 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pr ice $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances) 3 Year olds Claiming $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOGICAL AL stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing just out from the rail, pulled himself into a tracking trip in he run down the backside, battled for the lead from the inside of ENGLISH BAY TEDDY through the final turn, got the better of that rival leaving the turn and quickly drew clear as much the best. ENGLISH BAY TEDDY raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, ducked out slightly entering the backstretch and battled for the lead two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was no match for the winner in the late stages, but closed two out from the rail in the drive to prove clearly second best. BETTER TONE settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, advanced into a stalking trip entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. SELF SERVING settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, trailed the field in the run down the backside and into the final turn, saved ground through the turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. REMEMBERTHEALAMO broke sharply and tracked the pacesetter through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, checked briefly entering the backstretch when ENGLISH BAY TEDDY appeared to shy away from something and duck out, lost his momentum at that point, and steadily dropped back. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's' inquiry. The rider of REMEMBERTHEALAMO lodged a claim of foul against the rider of ENGLISH BAY TEDDY, for alleged interference entering the backstretch. After review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Self Serving
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, trailed, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Logical Al
ENTRY.OWNER: Canoe Pass Stables and MacPherson Craig
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied rail, led, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Better Tone
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rememberthealamo
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, checked 1/2, through

ENTRY.NAME: English Bay Teddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, ducked out 1/2, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 13 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pric e $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.

CLAIM.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J

RACE.FOOTNOTES: JERSEYS IMAGE broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the taxing early pace while racing out from the rail through the stretch the first time, set sail after the pacesetter three wide midway down the backside and collared the leader entering the final turn, assumed command leaving the turn, and was never threatened late. SILARONE settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, held a stalking trip in the run down the backside, rallied from along the inside through the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive to get up for the place. TUXEDO away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, raced into a stalking trip into the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished evenly two wide in the drive to just miss the place. JOCK TALK lagged well off the quick early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, launched his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing five wide in the drive. ASKMENOQUESTIONS away alertly and sprinted to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, opened a clear advantage through the stretch the first time, was quickly collared entering the final turn, fought gamely through the turn from the inside of JERSEY'S IMAGE, was no match for that rival entering the lane, and weakened late. EH TEE EM unhurried early while settling at the back of the pack entering the stretch the first time, continued to trail in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, and failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Askmenoquestions
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, clear lead, rallied inside, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Tuxedo
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Jock Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged inside, rallied rail, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Silarone
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Eh Tee Em
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied rail, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Jerseys Image
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: R. McLellan & Mr. & Mrs. H. J. Barroby

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 13 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances) 3 Year olds Claiming $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS THE HYPE unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch, advanced smartly from along the rail midway down the backside, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, steadied from along the rail entering final turn while lacking room at the rail, gathered herself up and tipped two wide entering the lane, and closed with a rush to prove best. TAM TRICKY away alertly and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backside, rallied two wide through the final turn, and closed willingly four wide in the drive to get up for the place. TIZ THE PROSPECT away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and into the final turn, held the narrowest of advantages into the lane, but faded from along the rail in deep stretch while holding on for a share. NINE OCLOCK CEASER rushed up three wide entering the first turn to duel for the early lead from the outside of TIZ THE PROSPECT, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide through the turn, but was outfinished in the stretch drive. FILLY FATALE broke sharply and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but was outfinished late. PENALTY TO RANGERS stalked the leaders from along the rail entering he backstretch, held a striking trip in the run to the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz the Prospect
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Penalty to Rangers
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Miss the Hype
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied rail, steadied 1/4, closed 2 w

ENTRY.NAME: Tam Tricky
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Filly Fatale
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Bill Breen Racing and Elder Matt
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked inside, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Nine Oclock Ceaser
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility And Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RACING RIVER away well and pressed the pace from the outside of QUAGMIRE entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and got the better of his pace rival late to prevail. QUAGMIRE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured from the inside of RACING RIVER in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, held the narrowest of advantages into the lane and just failed to last. STAR ENTRY tracked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn while maintaining his position and finished willingly three wide in the drive to garner a share. FOOT SOLDIER broke sharply, but was taken in hand and dropped back to trail entering he first turn, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished with late interest from along the rail in the drive. MORETHANSOULTITLE stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive while unable to mount a serious late bid. PARKER POINT stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, and faded over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Star Entry
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Foot Soldier
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Quagmire
ENTRY.OWNER: Henson Lorie Klimes Helen and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Morethansoultitle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Parker Point
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Racing River
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, prevailed
